channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China stocks see best week since 2008 on stimulus impact as most Asia markets rise
item.description: Hong Kong's Hang Seng index is set for a weekly gain of almost 13%, marking its best week since 1998.

item.title: Shigeru Ishiba is set to become Japan's next prime minister after winning ruling party leadership election
item.description: Ishiba defeated economic security minister Sanae Takaichi in a runoff, after the two won the most votes in the first round in a crowded field of nine candidates.

item.title: French inflation cools more than expected in September as energy prices, transport costs decline
item.description: France's harmonized inflation rate fell sharply in September, preliminary data from the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies showed Friday.

item.title: Commerzbank and UniCredit set to meet as takeover prospect looms
item.description: Commerzbank and UniCredit are set to begin talks Friday, with the German bank on the defensive over a potential takeover.

item.title: China's ambitions for semiconductor self-sufficiency thwarted by lack of chipmaking tools
item.description: Building more advanced lithography machines is a focal point in China's push to develop its domestic semiconductor industry with $96.3 billion in subsidies and preferential policies.

item.title: China's industrial profits plunge by 17.8% in August from a year ago
item.description: China's industrial profits plunged by the most in more than a year, National Bureau of Statistics data showed Friday.

item.title: The Fed slashed interest rates last week, but Treasury yields are rising. What's going on?
item.description: Despite a 50 basis point rate reduction, Treasury yields have been moving higher, particularly at the long end of the curve.

item.title: Not just China, Trump 2.0 could spell trouble for U.S. allies as he doubles down on tariff talk
item.description: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.

item.title: India wants to become a semiconductor powerhouse, but it can't do it on its own
item.description: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: More all-time highs? Yes please
item.description: The S&P 500 has touched new levels on more than 20% of trading days so far this year, noted financial firm Oppenheimer.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India grow as fast as China did?
item.description: The big banks of Wall Street have been quick to tweak what they expect from Indian growth this year.

item.title: Hong Kong's New World Development shares surge 23% after CEO resigns
item.description: The company said Chief Operating Officer Eric Ma Siu-Cheung has been appointed as the new CEO.

item.title: OpenAI CFO tells investors funding round should close by next week despite executive departures
item.description: OpenAI CFO Sarah Friar is looking to reassure its investors that the company is still in a strong position after losing top talent this week.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: A high of all-time highs
item.description: The S&P 500 has touched new levels on more than 20% of trading days so far this year, noted financial firm Oppenheimer.

item.title: China's Xi and top leaders call for halting real estate decline, responding to public concerns
item.description: While the meeting readout did not provide many details, it is significant for a country where policy directives are determined at the very top.

item.title: Sam Altman tells OpenAI staff there's no plan for him to receive 'giant equity stake' in company
item.description: At an all-hands meeting Thursday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman denied reports that he received a "giant equity stake" in the company.

item.title: 'Coolcations' had another big summer. Here are the places travelers went
item.description: Destinations like Lapland, Finland, and Breckenridge, Colorado, are seeing a rise in seasonal travelers, as visitors seek cooler temperatures in the summer.

item.title: Misinformation running rampant on Facebook has officials concerned about election disruptions
item.description: After Meta’s layoffs and deprioritizing of news and political content, local election officials say they’re in a precarious spot heading into the elections.

item.title: Major global chip stocks rally on Micron's surge; ASML up 4%
item.description: Micron shares rose in after-hours trade in the U.S. on Wednesday, sparking a rally

item.title: Eric Adams indictment unsealed: New York mayor charged in campaign contribution scheme
item.description: There are multiple federal investigations into New York City Mayor Eric Adams, members of his administration and people connected to the Democrat.

item.title: Bank of Japan board members split over monetary policy path, meeting minutes show
item.description: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.

item.title: Podcast: How pro video gaming, or esports, is taking off with big dollars behind it
item.description: In August, the first ever Esports World Cup concluded. It featured more than 1,500 players and a prize pool of $60 million.

item.title: Eric Adams federal probe hones in on little-known Turkish businessman
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams was indicted Thursday but a relationship with a little-known Turkish businessman has come to light.

item.title: Trump Media shareholder UAV dumped nearly 11 million shares
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is the majority owner of Trump Media, the Truth Social operator, whose shares trade under the DJT ticker.

item.title: UK finance chiefs are banging the drum for one major reform to boost economic growth
item.description: U.K. finance chiefs are banging the drum for pension reforms to boost anaemic investment and growth in the country.

item.title: Putin reveals new rules on nuclear weapons in Russia's latest warning to the West
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Moscow's position on when it can consider using nuclear weapons could change imminently.

item.title: Google venture arm backs startup aiming to bring mixed reality to any car windshield or plane cockpit
item.description: Distance Technologies, a Helsinki-based mixed-reality startup, raised 10 million euros of funding in a round led by GV, the venture capital arm of Alphabet.

item.title: Grubhub-owner Just Eat Takeaway to deliver sex toys in partnership with adult retailer Lovehoney
item.description: Grubhub-owner Just Eat Takeaway.com has partnered with sex toy retailer Lovehoney Group, in an unexpected expansion into the so-called sexual wellness sector.

item.title: Hoda Kotb announces she is leaving NBC's 'TODAY' show
item.description: Veteran journalist and "TODAY" fourth-hour host Hoda Kotb announced she will be leaving the show early next year.

item.title: Swiss central bank cuts rates by a quarter point in third trim this year
item.description: It was the first major Western central bank to reduce interest rates back in March.
